reviews.review_msg: TAKING 303 WITH HIM IS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. EXAMS ARE STRAIGHTFORWARD AND TOTALLY BASED ON THE SLIDES. CLASS DISCUSSION IS FASCINATING.

AWESOME prof. He's so knowledgeable and is really good at initiating discussion. I loved going to lecture every week. Textbook is useless. Tests are based on powerpoints. Be really thorough when answering test questions. Class work seems easy enough but he can be picky with marking. One presentation and case study with group.
The class is fun. He shows a lot of videos. He doesn't impose but wants you to think and take responsibility. He definitely knows his stuff and can deliver it in clear manner.

He's nice and funny but all he did is to read from the powerpoint slides and somehow facilitate class discussion. Midterm is easy because all questions came from lecture notes, and final is in a similar manner. He is not very clear on paper/presentation requirements but overall he's easy & fair.

He is honestly one of the best profs in SFU. His lectures are very interesting and he always encouragae student to discuss with the class. He also introduces current global issues for student to talk about every lecture.
Good prof. His classes were very interesting and entertaining. He provides all direct and clear instructions to study for his exams.

Good teacher. Interesting and entertaining class. The group presentations were sometimes a bit of a drag. For exams study the notes and listen to what he says and you are gold. He knows his stuff and is enthusiastic to share it with us. finally love the motivational music before the exam starts.

He may be knowledgeable about the subject but he cannot teach it! His power point slides are all over the place and he doesn't use the textbook so there's no where else to look for information if his lectures are unclear. Just memorize the slides and you should be okay for the tests however I didn't learn anything valuable in this class.
